parts: Name this process that forms the three-dimensional structure of macromolecules such as insulin and hemoglobin. In it, long chains of peptides are assembled into complex shapes.
Protein folding begins with this level of protein structure which refers to its sequence of amino acids. This level precedes the secondary and tertiary structures.

Mistakes in protein folding can lead to the formation of these misfolded proteins, which can cause neurodegenerative diseases such as mad cow disease or Creutzfeldt-Jakob (CROYTS-felt YAH-kub) syndrome.
Name this country home to artists like Rembrandt van Rijn (van RINE), who moved from Leiden to its capital of Amsterdam.
This Dutchman depicted his hometown in his View of Delft. He also created The Milkmaid and Girl with a Pearl Earring.
This other Dutchman collaborated with his brother Hubert on the Ghent Altarpiece. He painted the Arnolfini Wedding.

answers: the NFL [or the National Football League]
parts: Name this Western New York city on the northeast corner of Lake Erie. The Peace Bridge connects this city to Fort Erie, Ontario.
This massive waterfall lies about 20 miles northwest of Buffalo, and gives its name to cities in both New York and Ontario. It is the largest waterfall in the U.S. by flow rate.
Sports fans in Buffalo are known for their passionate support for the Buffalo Bills, who play in this professional league which also includes the New England Patriots and the Denver Broncos.

Messier catalogued 110 astronomical objects, including many of these masses of trillions of stars, which can come in elliptical and irregular shapes, among others, and often have supermassive black holes at their center.
The 24th entry in the catalogue is a “star cloud” located in this constellation, which is also home to the black hole at the center of the Milky Way. Its name comes from the Latin for “archer”.
The 45th entry in the Messier catalogue, and the closest to Earth, is this star cluster easily visible to the naked eye and also called the Seven Sisters.

answers: George Wallace [or George C[orley] Wallace, Jr.]
the Ku Klux Klan [or the KKK; accept Klansmen or just the Klan]
parts: Name this Democrat who vowed to enforce "segregation now, segregation tomorrow, and segregation forever" in a 1963 inaugural address.
Wallace served as governor of this southern U.S. state for a total of sixteen years. Rosa Parks' arrest served as the catalyst for a bus boycott in this state's capital of Montgomery.

During Wallace's first year in office, four African American girls were killed when the 16th Street Baptist Church in Birmingham was bombed by members of this organization. William J. Simmons helped revive this group in 1915.
Name this nation, Kenya's southern neighbor, which also contains the highest point in its continent. Its capital was moved to Dodoma in 1996.
This dormant volcano in Tanzania is the highest mountain in Africa.
Tanzania has a significant coastline on this ocean, part of the greater "Swahili Coast" region next to it. The Bay of Bengal and the Arabian Sea are separated by the country this ocean is named for.
Zeus abducted this woman, King Minos’s mother, in the form of a bull. Her brother Cadmus brought the alphabet to Greece.
Zeus was once married to Thetis, a leader of the Nereids who gave birth to this warrior. Thetis dipped him in the River Styx, causing him to be invulnerable except for his heel.

Zeus employed this nymph to distract Hera during his affairs with lengthy conversations, leading Hera to curse her to only repeat the last words said to her. She eventually fell in love with Narcissus.
Name these polygons with three sides. Their interior angles always sum to 180 degrees.
This term refers to the line segment connecting a vertex to the midpoint of the opposite side of a triangle.
This point is the intersection of the three medians of a triangle. It is also the triangle's center of gravity.

answers: starting a fire [accept anything indicating setting things on fire or similar descriptions]
parts: Identify this character who is killed when Roger drops a boulder on him. His glasses are stolen by Jack to establish his group's power.
Piggy is a character in this novel by William Golding in which a group of schoolboys are stranded on a deserted island.

Piggy's glasses are stolen because they are the only object on the island capable of this task. After Jack's tribe is unexpectedly successful at using the glasses for this task, a passing ship sees the resulting smoke and rescues the children.
Name this American author who wrote about the child Pearl and Hester Prynne.

This other American author said that Hawthorne "shoots his strong New England roots into the deep soil of my Southern soul" in one of several thinly-veiled love letters. He is better known for writing Moby-Dick.
Moby-Dick depicts the crew of the Pequod hunting a massive white one of these animals.

answers: the Czech Republic [or Czechia, or Czechoslovakia]
a party [accept The Garden Party; accept The Birthday Party]
parts: Name this Central European country home to authors such as Jaroslav Hašek (YAR-oh-sloff HAH-sheck) and Milan Kundera, who wrote The Unbearable Lightness of Being, depicting life under communist rule in this country.
In The Good Soldier Švejk, the title character sells these animals. The title character of Jack London's White Fang is one of these animals.
Czech author Vaclav Havel (VAHTS-loff HAH-vel) wrote a play titled for one of these events in a garden. Harold Pinter wrote an absurdist play titled for a "birthday" one of these events.
The most famous 100 Gecs song is titled for a machine of this material. Types of this stuff around the world include the rupee, the peso, and the dollar.
The cover of 100 Gecs's album 1000 Gecs features one of these objects located in Algonquin, Illinois. Shel Silverstein wrote a book about a "Giving" one of these objects.

100 Gecs is known for their use of autotune, like bands Attack Attack! and Abandon All Ships, which belong to a subgenre of metalcore named for this animal. These animals also appear in the music video for a Noisestorm song.
Name this nation governed from New Delhi. Narendra Modi is this nation's current Prime Minister.
India fought this neighboring country over Jammu and Kashmir. Benazir Bhutto served as Prime Minister of this nation, and she was assassinated after a political rally held in Rawalpindi.

This is the dominant religion of Jammu and Kashmir. As chief minister of Gujarat, Narendra Modi was criticized for his role in a spate of deadly riots against members of this religion, a minority religion in India.
Name this type of reaction, one of the half reactions of redox reactions, along with reduction. In this reaction, electrons are lost, while in reduction, electrons are gained.
In one of these objects, redox reactions occur in the cathode and the anode, converting chemical energy to electrical energy. Examples of these include the 9 volt, AA, and AAA varieties.
Many commercial batteries use this metallic element with atomic number 3 as an anode.

answers: Russia [or the Russian Federation; accept Rossiya]
parts: Name this world leader, who recently gained the power to potentially stay in office until 2036 after his country voted for constitutional changes that extended term limits.
For years, Vladimir Putin has served as the president of this largest nation in the world by area.
Amid August 2020 protests in this country, Putin gave military support to this country's leader Alexander Lukashenko, who is often called "Europe's last dictator."

answers: Aztec Empire [or the Triple Alliance, or ̄Ēxcān Tlatōlōyan]
Moctezuma II [or Montezuma, or Motecuhzomatzin, or Motecuhzoma Xocoyotzin]
parts: Identify this Mesoamerican empire whose capital was Tenochtitlan. They were defeated by Hernan Cortez.
This Aztec emperor exchanged gifts with Cortez at Cortez's first arrival before his eventual defeat.
Tenochtitlan is now the location of this city, the largest city in North America and the largest Spanish-speaking city in the world.

answers: Republic of the Philippines [or Republika ng Pilipinas]
parts: Rodrigo Duterte is the current leader of this country, whose capital is Manila. America took possession of it after the Spanish-American War.
Once Marcos was exiled, he lived in this state, formerly known as the Sandwich Islands. They became an American possession after they were ruled by 5 kings named Kamehameha.

Both Hawaii and the Philippines were settled by Austronesians, who are generally considered to have emigrated from this Asian island, where the Dutch East India Company established Fort Zeelandia. It was historically known as Formosa.

Name this Jewish holiday commemorating the exodus of the Israelites from Egypt. On this holiday, Jews participate in large family celebrations called seders (SAY-durz) that involve a series of specific rituals.
The Seder is conducted according to a script laid out in one of these books. The most commonly used one of these books in the U.S. is published every year by Maxwell House Coffee.

During the Seder, participants remove a drop of water from their cup with a fingertip while recounting each of this many plagues that were inflicted on the Egyptians. This is also the number of commandments that Moses received on Mount Sinai.
What English scientist developed calculus along with Gottfried Leibniz?
This magnum opus of Newton lays out the beginnings of classical mechanics. Another book with this name, by Bertrand Russell and Alfred Whitehead, describes the axiomatic construction of mathematics.
Newton also wrote a book about, and named for, this subfield of physics. It studied the effects of prisms and lenses, and argued that light was made up of particles called corpuscles.

answers: Charles XII [accept Carolus Rex; prompt on Charles]
parts: Name this country whose possessions of Ingria and Estonia were captured during the war. It is led from Stockholm.
This Swedish monarch was 17 when the coalition declared war; he went into exile after the disastrous Battle of Poltava.
Charles XII returned and attempted to campaign against this country under Danish personal union; he attempted to besiege its cities of Trondheim and Fredricksten, but he died in battle.
